title.narrative: Addressing Violent Conflict in Tonj North County

description.narrative:
Addressing conflict through cattle camp youth leaders, and local governance to address the current tensions on-going in Tonj North county of Warrap state. The activities will be implemented through community dialogue , workshops and reconciliation trainings in 5 payams of Awul,Kirrik,Rualbet,Akop and Alabek specifically. The project proposes two way approaches for instance i) Assessments to arrived to lasting peace approach with armed youth leaders ii) engage local authorities and CSOs to jointly support peace in the area through true reconciliation. so that the perpetrators to the violence of the conflicts are held accountable. TOCH shall work closely with various actors to ensure that peace agreement provisions are respected. Formation and training of Peace committees will be conducted throughout the project implementation. Most of the activities will target especially cattle camps youth who are engaged in most of these violent conflicts through cattle raiding and revenge attacks or killings, chiefs, women, spiritual leaders and local authorities such payam administrators and county commissioner will be involved during community mobilization stages.
The overall goal of this project is to enhance peaceful co-existence and safer communities in Tonj North County, Warrap state with the following three objectives: i) Engaging Communities specifically youth and women through various peace approaches; ii) Increasing knowledge of human rights and facilitating access to justice iii) Strengthening capacities of communities, authorities and civil society organisations for collective action for durable peace in Tonj North county The proposed activities will be implemented based on the above objectives which shall be guiding principles to achieving in the area although dialogues initiative would come in through recommendation from peace committees through their advocacy meetings within the bomas or payams.
